narrative.title: First Army - 1942Q4
narrative.situation: British Field Army deployed in North Africa during 1942Q4.
narrative.objectives: Expeditionary field army formed for Operation Torch - amphibious invasion of French North Africa (Algiers sector) and rapid advance into Tunisia to seize Tunis and Bizerta before Axis reinforcement. Mission: Coordinate Allied forces (British, American, French) in Tunisia Campaign.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: Tunisian/Algerian terrain - VERY different from Western Desert. Hills, valleys, farmland, mountains. Heavy rains November-December turn roads and tracks to mud, severely limiting tank mobility. Coastal plains near landing beaches, mountainous terrain along Tunisia-Algeria border.

air_support.theater_command: RAF Middle East Command / Desert Air Force

special_rules: Coalition warfare coordination (British, US, French forces)

environment.terrain_type: Tunisian/Algerian terrain - VERY different from Western Desert. Hills, valleys, farmland, mountains. Heavy rains November-December turn roads and tracks to mud, severely limiting tank mobility. Coastal plains near landing beaches, mountainous terrain along Tunisia-Algeria border.

theater_air_command.designation: RAF Middle East Command / Desert Air Force

unit_composition.note: Includes all RAF, RAAF, SAAF, and other Commonwealth squadrons supporting 8th Army

data_source.extraction_method: Battle records aggregate + standard RAF establishments

air_support.integration_note: Same RAF air forces support both 8th and 1st Armies in theater
